questions.question: What is the primary purpose of preparing standard solutions in analytical chemistry?

answers.a: To serve as a reference for quantitative analysis

explanations.a: Standard solutions are prepared with known concentrations to serve as references in quantitative analysis.
explanations.b: Standard solutions are not used for cleaning purposes.
explanations.c: Storage is not the primary purpose of standard solutions.
explanations.d: While standards may be used in dilution, this is not their primary purpose.

questions.question: Which of the following is essential when preparing a primary standard?

explanations.a: Primary standards must be of exceptionally high purity.
explanations.b: Color is irrelevant for a primary standard.
explanations.c: While low MW can be helpful, it's not the only requirement.
explanations.d: Solubility in all solvents is not necessary.

questions.question: What is the proper way to prepare a standard solution by dilution?

answers.a: Measure the solute carefully and dilute to the mark in a volumetric flask
answers.b: Add arbitrary amounts of solute and solvent
answers.c: Mix concentrated solutions with water in a beaker
answers.d: Evaporate solvent from a more concentrated solution

explanations.a: Volumetric flasks provide precise measurement for standard preparation.
explanations.b: Arbitrary measurements won't give accurate concentrations.
explanations.c: Beakers don't provide precise volume measurement.
explanations.d: Evaporation would concentrate, not dilute, a solution.

questions.question: Why is it important to standardize some solutions before use?

explanations.a: Standardization establishes the precise concentration of a solution.
explanations.b: The chemical composition typically remains unchanged.
explanations.d: While impurities may affect standardization, removal isn't the main goal.

questions.question: Which glassware is most appropriate for preparing a standard solution?

explanations.a: Volumetric flasks are designed for precise solution preparation.
explanations.b: Graduated cylinders lack the precision needed for standards.
explanations.c: Beakers don't provide accurate volume measurement.
explanations.d: Erlenmeyer flasks aren't designed for precise volume measurements.
